definitions.definition: A formal written request made by an individual or a group of people to a sovereign or political authority , often containing many signatures, soliciting some grace , right , mercy , or the redress of some wrong or grievance .
examples: We're looking to get 10,000 people to sign the petition to have the bird colony given legal protection.

definitions.definition: A formal written application made to a magistrate or court for an order or a suit for divorce .
A prayer or supplication , especially of which is formal or humble and made to a deity , a sovereign , or an authority .
examples: a petition to God for courage and strength

main_definition: A formal written request made by an individual or a group of people to a sovereign or political authority , often containing many signatures, soliciting some grace , right , mercy , or the redress of some wrong or grievance . [from early 15th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( law , by extension ) A formal written application made to a magistrate or court for an order or a suit for divorce . [from 1730s]
A prayer or supplication , especially of which is formal or humble and made to a deity , a sovereign , or an authority . [from c. 1330]
